alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 7:20AM CDT until August 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .Heavy rainfall possible Friday morning through Saturday morning from remnants of Tropical Storm Harold. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of panhandle Nebraska, including the following county, Cheyenne County. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall has been observed at the KSNY ASOS, which has picked up 0.86" in about an hour in the first round of thunderstorms. Radar trends show thunderstorms are training over the area which will add to the already high rainfall totals. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
